New Records: Sean Manaea pitched 7 shutout innings with 2 hits and 2 walks, allowing 5 strikeouts.
Francisco Lindor hit his 29th home run of the season, extending his on-base streak to 30 games.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea dominated the White Sox, allowing only 2 hits and 2 walks over 7 innings.
Francisco Lindor led off the fourth inning with a solo home run.
The White Sox set a franchise record with their 107th loss, matching the 1962 Mets for the worst season in MLB history.
Post-Match Reflections: Sean Manaea expressed pride in his performance and the team's effort.
Francisco Lindor highlighted the team's strong run and playoff chances.
Manager Carlos Mendoza praised Manaea's demeanor and the team's resilience.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets struggled offensively, striking out 16 times but managing only 12 runs over the series.
Garrett Crochet tied a White Sox record by striking out seven straight batters.
